intro: Ranunculus vjatkensis, commonly known as the Vjatkian buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are bright yellow with numerous petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
